Key Match Events: Joel Embiid had 37 points and nine rebounds as the Philadelphia 76ers defeated the Portland Trail Blazers 125-103.
Tyrese Maxey added 23 points for the Sixers.
Kelly Oubre Jr. had 15 points and eight steals.
Guerschon Yabusele had 16 points off the bench.
Anfernee Simons led the Blazers with 25 points on 9-of-18 shooting.
Deni Avdija had 17 points but also 10 turnovers.
Shaedon Sharpe, Toumani Camara and Deandre Ayton each scored 12.
The Blazers struggled shooting the 3, going 8 for 36 from long range (22.2%) as a team.
The Sixers won comfortably despite Paul George being limited to just 22 minutes due to foul trouble.
Philadelphia scored 36 points off Portland’s 26 turnovers while limiting the Blazers to 21 points on their own 19 turnovers.
With the game tied early in the second quarter, the Sixers went on a 13-0 run over three minutes to pull away from the Blazers, who never caught up.
